an5.164:1.1: There Venerable Sāriputta addressed the mendicants:
an5.164:1.2: “A mendicant with five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.
an5.164:1.4: A mendicant is personally accomplished in ethics, and answers questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in ethics.
an5.164:1.8: They’re personally accomplished in the knowledge and vision of freedom, and they answer questions that come up when discussing accomplishment in the knowledge and vision of freedom.
an5.164:1.9: A mendicant with these five qualities is fit to share their life with their spiritual companions.”
